column5: I carry both for the same reason. The inflatables when we're under power, and then the regulars in the netting in the bow cover us for drifting/non-power situations.

I selected you, but anybody can answer. I realize I need to have a life vest or PFD per person on the boat. But my question is this, does it have to be worn? Now before anybody gives me a scalding, I DO wear it, I'm only asking if Ontario requires you to wear it, or if it just needs to be in the boat? Thanks, ChuckBearfvr13
We asked and if I remember correctly they do not have to be worn but must be accessible.
Unless it is an inflatable vest. Those must be worn to count.

You need to have them onboard but you don't need to wear them. I believe the other responses are correct as well.....accessible.... and worn if it's an inflatable. I was hoping for a controversial question to stoke the fires of WC.

Is the reason you have to wear an inflatable vest is that if thrown to a person in the water (who wasn't wearing it), it could sink? This presumes the unlikely event that it doesn't automatically inflate when thrown in. FYI, I started using one this year and really like it, especially on hot days.
If the inflatable vest does inflate before a person has it on I don't think you will be able to get it over your head to wear it. wmd

We got stopped while fishing this july by the MNR and one boat only had inflatables and i had both in my boat. The officer the other boat talked too said theres had to be worn. I had both life vests and pfds so we did not.
